item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You can never be overdressed or overeducated." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The truth is rarely pure and never simple." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I think God, in creating man, somewhat overestimated his ability." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "You can't measure the mutual affection of two human beings by the number of words they exchange." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Chance and chance alone has a message for us. Everything that occurs out of necessity, everything expected, repeated day in and day out, is mute. Only chance can speak to us." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Humanity's true moral test, its fundamental test, consists of its attitude towards those who are at its mercy: animals. And in this respect humankind has suffered a fundamental debacle, a debacle so fundamental that all others stem from it." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "I have no mission. No one has." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "When men stop believing in God, it isn't that they then believe in nothing: they believe in everything." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "... luckily, Eden is soon populated. The ethical dimension begins when the other appears on the scene." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Pablo Neruda
item.description: "I love you without knowing how, or when, or from where. I love you simply, without problems or pride: I love you in this way because I do not know any other way of loving but this, in which there is no I or you, so intimate that your hand upon my chest is my hand, so intimate that when I fall asleep your eyes close." -- Pablo Neruda

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "The individual has always had to struggle to keep from being overwhelmed by the tribe. If you try it, you will be lonely often, and sometimes frightened. But no price is too high to pay for the privilege of owning yourself." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "In heaven, all the interesting people are missing." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche
item.description: "You have your way. I have my way. As for the right way, the correct way, and the only way, it does not exist." -- Friedrich Wilhelm Nietzsche

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Susan Sontag
item.description: "Interpretation is the revenge of the intellectual upon art. " -- Susan Sontag

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Simone de Beauvoir
item.description: "One is not born, but rather becomes, a woman." -- Simone de Beauvoir

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Karl Marx
item.description: "...[G]reat progress was evident in the last Congress of the American 'Labour Union' in that among other things, it treated working women with complete equality. While in this respect the English, and still more the gallant French, are burdened with a spirit of narrow-mindedness. Anybody who knows anything of history knows that great social changes are impossible without the feminine ferment. Social progress can be measured exactly by the social position of the fair sex (the ugly ones included)." -- Karl Marx

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Karl Marx
item.description:
"The philosophers have only <i>interpreted</i> the world, in various ways. The point, however, is to <i>change</i> it.
[<i>These words are also inscribed upon his grave</i>]" -- Karl Marx

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Elbert Hubbard
item.description: "God will not look you over for medals, degrees or diplomas but for scars." -- Elbert Hubbard

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Abigail Van Buren
item.description: "The best index to a person's character is how he treats people who can't do him any good, and how he treats people who can't fight back." -- Abigail Van Buren

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Plato
item.description: "The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men." -- Plato

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Geoff Johns
item.description: "I may not be smart enough to do everything, but I am dumb enough to try anything." -- Geoff Johns

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Those who believe in telekinetics, raise my hand." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The difference between genius and stupidity is; genius has its limits." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Sikoni add a quote by Don Marquis
item.description: "Procrastination is the art of keeping up with yesterday" -- Don Marquis
